definitions.definition: To hunt about, especially for something of nominal value; to scavenge or glean .
To obtain something of moderate or inconsequential value from another.
examples: As long as he's got someone who'll let him scrounge off them, he'll never settle down and get a full-time job.

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To hunt about, especially for something of nominal value; to scavenge or glean .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To obtain something of moderate or inconsequential value from another.
